page.title: 01Cranborne Chase
page.content: This area consists whlly of rolling chalky grassland interspersed with beech and coniferous woods. Thre are a few large farms and on hamlet including a couple of small farms at Stubhampton. it is here that the River Tarrant rises to flow through from Tarrant Gunville into the Stour at Tarrant Crawford. The whole area has changed litttle in character and appearance since Cranborne Chase, of which it forms a part, passed from the monarchy to private ownership. The farms of Everley Hill, Glebe Farm and Newfield farm are all mixed arable, sheep and beef cattle and Everley Hill has a large dairy unit. Harbins park and Drove Barn Farm form part of the estate owned by the occupants of the Manor House in Tarrant Gunville.
